intro: Rhynchospora contraligularis, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikegrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This perennial herb typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and bogs, where it thrives in moist to saturated soils. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various pollinators and wildlife.
